channel.title: attack.t1218 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.t1218 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: DevInit Lolbin Download
item.description: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by devinit.exe lolbin to download arbitrary MSI packages on a Windows system

item.title: NodejsTools PressAnyKey Lolbin
item.description: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by Microsoft.NodejsTools.PressAnyKey.exe that can be used to execute any other binary

item.title: False Sysinternals Suite Tools
item.description: Rename as a legitim Sysinternals Suite tools to evade detection

item.title: Suspicious Extexport Execution
item.description: Extexport.exe loads dll and is execute from other folder the original path

item.title: Suspicious Load DLL via CertOC.exe
item.description: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to loads the target DLL file.

item.title: Execution via stordiag.exe
item.description: Detects the use of stordiag.exe to execute schtasks.exe systeminfo.exe and fltmc.exe

item.title: Execution via WorkFolders.exe
item.description: Detects using WorkFolders.exe to execute an arbitrary control.exe

item.title: Cabinet File Expansion
item.description: Adversaries can use the inbuilt expand utility to decompress cab files as seen in recent Iranian MeteorExpress attack

item.title: SyncAppvPublishingServer VBS Execute Arbitrary PowerShell Code
item.description: Executes arbitrary PowerShell code using SyncAppvPublishingServer.vbs

item.title: Abusable Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand
item.description: RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe is an abusable, signed PowerShell host executable that was introduced in Windows 10 and Server 2019 (OS Build 17763.1339).

item.title: ProtocolHandler.exe Downloaded Suspicious File
item.description: Emulates attack via documents through protocol handler in Microsoft Office. On successful execution you should see Microsoft Word launch a blank file.

item.title: Mavinject Inject DLL Into Running Process
item.description: Injects arbitrary DLL into running process specified by process ID. Requires Windows 10.

item.title: Curl Start Combination
item.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.

item.title: Renamed ZOHO Dctask64
item.description: Detects a renamed dctask64.exe used for process injection, command execution, process creation with a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dnx.exe
item.description: Execute C# code located in the consoleapp folder

item.title: Possible App Whitelisting Bypass via WinDbg/CDB as a Shellcode Runner
item.description: Launch 64-bit shellcode from a debugger script file using cdb.exe.

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Bginfo
item.description: Execute VBscript code that is referenced within the *.bgi file.

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dxcap.exe
item.description: Detects execution of of Dxcap.exe

item.title: Devtoolslauncher.exe Executes Specified Binary
item.description: The Devtoolslauncher.exe executes other binary

item.title: OpenWith.exe Executes Specified Binary
item.description: The OpenWith.exe executes other binary

item.title: MavInject Process Injection
item.description: Detects process injection using the signed Windows tool Mavinject32.exe

item.title: Microsoft Workflow Compiler
item.description: Detects invocation of Microsoft Workflow Compiler, which may permit the execution of arbitrary unsigned code.

item.title: Possible Applocker Bypass
item.description: Detects execution of executables that can be used to bypass Applocker whitelisting

item.title: Windows Shell Spawning Suspicious Program
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Windows shell

item.title: Abusing Findstr for Defense Evasion
item.description: Attackers can use findstr to hide their artifacts or search specific strings and evade defense mechanism

item.title: Abusing Print Executable
item.description: Attackers can use print.exe for remote file copy

item.title: Atbroker Registry Change
item.description: Detects creation/modification of Assisitive Technology applications and persistence with usage of ATs

item.title: Custom Class Execution via Xwizard
item.description: Detects the execution of Xwizard tool with specific arguments which utilized to run custom class properties.

item.title: DLL Execution via Rasautou.exe
item.description: Detects using Rasautou.exe for loading arbitrary .DLL specified in -d option and executes the export specified in -p.

item.title: Dllhost Internet Connection
item.description: Detects Dllhost that communicates with public IP addresses

item.title: Dotnet.exe Exec Dll and Execute Unsigned Code LOLBIN
item.description: dotnet.exe will execute any DLL and execute unsigned code

item.title: Execute Files with Msdeploy.exe
item.description: Detects file execution using the msdeploy.exe lolbin

item.title: Execution DLL of Choice Using WAB.EXE
item.description: This rule detects that the path to the DLL written in the registry is different from the default one. Launched WAB.exe tries to load the DLL from Registry.

item.title: Execution via Diskshadow.exe
item.description: Detects using Diskshadow.exe to execute arbitrary code in text file

item.title: Indirect Command Execution By Program Compatibility Wizard
item.description: Detect indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant pcwrun.exe

item.title: Malicious PE Execution by Microsoft Visual Studio Debugger
item.description: There is an option for a MS VS Just-In-Time Debugger “vsjitdebugger.exe” to launch specified executable and attach a debugger. This option may be used adversaries to execute malicious code by signed verified binary. The debugger is installed alongside with Microsoft Visual Studio package.

item.title: Malicious Windows Script Components File Execution by TAEF Detection
item.description: Windows Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) framework allows you to run automation by executing tests files written on different languages (C, C#, Microsoft COM Scripting interfaces). Adversaries may execute malicious code (such as WSC file with VBScript, dll and so on) directly by running te.exe

item.title: Mshta Spawning Windows Shell
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a mshta.exe process

item.title: Proxy Execution Via Explorer.exe
item.description: Attackers can use explorer.exe for evading defense mechanisms

item.title: Renamed MegaSync
item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed meg.exe of MegaSync during incident response engagements associated with ransomware families like Nefilim, Sodinokibi, Pysa, and Conti.

item.title: Squirrel Lolbin
item.description: Detects Possible Squirrel Packages Manager as Lolbin

item.title: Suspcious CLR Logs Creation
item.description: Detects suspicious .NET assembly executions. Could detect using Cobalt Strike’s command execute-assembly.

item.title: Suspicious Atbroker Execution
item.description: Atbroker executing non-deafualt Assistive Technology applications

item.title: Suspicious Esentutl Use
item.description: Detects flags often used with the LOLBAS Esentutl for malicious activity. It could be used in rare cases by administrators to access locked files or during maintenance.

item.title: Suspicious OfflineScannerShell.exe Execution From Another Folder
item.description: Use OfflineScannerShell.exe to execute mpclient.dll library in the current working directory

item.title: Suspicious Registration via cscript.exe
item.description: Detects when the registration of a VSS/VDS Provider as a COM+ application.

item.title: Suspicious ZipExec Execution
item.description: ZipExec is a Proof-of-Concept (POC) tool to wrap binary-based tools into a password-protected zip file.

item.title: SyncAppvPublishingServer Execution to Bypass Powershell Restriction
item.description: Detects SyncAppvPublishingServer process execution which usually utilized by adversaries to bypass PowerShell execution restrictions.

item.title: Time Travel Debugging Utility Usage
item.description: Detects usage of Time Travel Debugging Utility. Adversaries can execute malicious processes and dump processes, such as lsass.exe, via tttracer.exe.

item.title: Using AppVLP To Circumvent ASR File Path Rule
item.description: Application Virtualization Utility is included with Microsoft Office. We are able to abuse “AppVLP” to execute shell commands. Normally, this binary is used for Application Virtualization, but we can use it as an abuse binary to circumvent the ASR file path rule folder or to mark a file as a system file.

item.title: Verclsid.exe Runs COM Object
item.description: Detects when verclsid.exe is used to run COM object via GUID

item.title: Windows Update Client LOLBIN
item.description: Detects code execution via the Windows Update client (wuauclt)

item.title: WSL Execution
item.description: Detects Possible usage of Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) binary as a LOLBIN

item.title: Wuauclt Network Connection
item.description: Detects the use of the Windows Update Client binary (wuauclt.exe) to proxy execute code and making a network connections. One could easily make the DLL spawn a new process and inject to it to proxy the network connection and bypass this rule.
